reference: Volume Four, Issue Thirty-Nine, File 1 of 13
title: You're Not Dealing With AT&T
historical_context: This issue precedes SummerCon '92 and discusses the early hacker culture and legal challenges faced by hackers.
target_audience: Hackers, security professionals, and those interested in hacker culture history.
short_summary: This issue of Phrack features a variety of articles, including a profile on Shadow Hawk 1, the first hacker prosecuted under the Computer Fraud & Abuse Act, and a detailed guide to the DIALOG Information Network.
summary:
In this issue of Phrack, the staff introduces a range of topics relevant to the hacker community, including a retrospective on Shadow Hawk 1, who was notably the first hacker prosecuted under the Computer Fraud & Abuse Act. The article sheds light on the legal implications of hacking during the late 1980s and early 1990s, emphasizing the evolving relationship between hackers and law enforcement. It also touches on the ongoing legal battles faced by prominent figures in the hacking community, such as Knight Lightning, who was involved in a high-profile case against the government and telecommunications companies.

Additionally, the issue features a comprehensive guide to the DIALOG Information Network, showcasing the depth of resources available to hackers and researchers at the time. The article aims to equip readers with the knowledge needed to navigate and utilize this information network effectively. Overall, Phrack 39 serves as a crucial snapshot of the hacker culture during a pivotal time in its history, highlighting both the challenges and resources available to those within the community.
